Package Enginegames

Class Button

java.lang.Object
Enginegames.WorldObj
Enginegames.Button
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Label, ScrollButton, Textfield
public abstract class Button
extends WorldObj
A basic Button one is able to put into ones world. When being clicked an event is called.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.awt.Color backgroundColor
    The Background color of the Button.
    java.awt.Color backgroundHoverColor
    The Color the button turns into, while being pressed and not released Default Value: Color.LIGHT_GRAY
    AdvancedImage backgroundImage
    An optional Image, which gets drawn onto the Button.
    java.awt.Color borderColor
    The Border color of the Button.
    int borderWidth
    The size of the border around the image.
    static java.awt.Font defaultFont
    The default Font of the Buttons text.
    boolean enabled
    If one is able to use the button Default Value: {@link true}
    java.awt.Font font
    The custom font for each button.
    int height
    The height of the Button in pixel If you want it to occupy one field of the world use World.pixelSize Default Value: 100 px
    java.lang.String text
    A line of text one is able to display on the button.
    java.awt.Color textColor
    The Color the text has, when drawn onto the button.
    int width
    the width of the Button in pixel If you want it to occupy one field of the world use World.pixelSize Default Value: 400 px

  • Field Details

    • text

      public java.lang.String text
      A line of text one is able to display on the button. Default Value: "" (empty string)

    • width

      public int width
      the width of the Button in pixel If you want it to occupy one field of the world use World.pixelSize Default Value: 400 px

    • height

      public int height
      The height of the Button in pixel If you want it to occupy one field of the world use World.pixelSize Default Value: 100 px

    • borderWidth

      public int borderWidth
      The size of the border around the image. Default Value: 5 px

    • textColor

      public java.awt.Color textColor
      The Color the text has, when drawn onto the button. Default Value: Color.BLACK

    • backgroundColor

      public java.awt.Color backgroundColor
      The Background color of the Button. Default Value: Color.WHITE

    • backgroundHoverColor

      public java.awt.Color backgroundHoverColor
      The Color the button turns into, while being pressed and not released Default Value: Color.LIGHT_GRAY

    • borderColor

      public java.awt.Color borderColor
      The Border color of the Button. for the default size, look at borderWidth Default Value: Color.BLACK

    • font

      public java.awt.Font font
      The custom font for each button. If none is present (font == null) the defaultFont is used instead

    • defaultFont

      public static java.awt.Font defaultFont
      The default Font of the Buttons text. Default Value: SERIF, plain font of size 20 px

    • backgroundImage

      public AdvancedImage backgroundImage
      An optional Image, which gets drawn onto the Button. Default Value: {@link null}

    • enabled

      public boolean enabled
      If one is able to use the button Default Value: {@link true}

  • Constructor Details

    • Button

      public Button()
      Creates a new Button. This actually does nothing, but redraw itself.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public final void update()
      updates the displayed button

    • _mouseEvent

      public final void _mouseEvent​(MouseEventInfo e)
      called when the button is clicked.
      Overrides:
      _mouseEvent in class WorldObj
      Parameters:
      e - the event created by the click

    • clickEvent

      public abstract void clickEvent​(MouseEventInfo e)
      Called once the button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      e - the click event information

    • setSize

      public final void setSize​(int width, int height)
      updates the size of the button
      Parameters:
      width - the new width of the button in pixel
      height - the new height of the button in pixel

    • setBorderWidth

      public final void setBorderWidth​(int width)
      sets the new border width, around the buttons background. set to 0 for no border
      Parameters:
      width - the new width in pixel

    • setFont

      public final void setFont​(java.awt.Font font)
      sets the font, which is used to write on the button
      Parameters:
      font - the new font

    • setText

      public final void setText​(java.lang.String text)
      sets the currently displayed text of the button
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be displayed

    • setTextColor

      public final void setTextColor​(java.awt.Color textColor)
      updates the text color to the specified color
      Parameters:
      textColor - the color, the text should shine in

    • setBackgroundColor

      public final void setBackgroundColor​(java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
      sets the background color of the image
      Parameters:
      backgroundColor - the color the background of the button should be

    • setBackgroundHoverColor

      public final void setBackgroundHoverColor​(java.awt.Color backgroundHoverColor)
      the color, the background is in, when clicked and hold
      Parameters:
      backgroundHoverColor - the new color

    • setBorderColor

      public final void setBorderColor​(java.awt.Color borderColor)
      sets the color, surrounding the button
      Parameters:
      borderColor - the new color

    • setBackgroundImage

      public final void setBackgroundImage​(AdvancedImage backgroundImage)
      sets the image the button has
      Parameters:
      backgroundImage - the image displayed on the button

    • _update

      public void _update()
      An update function one can add code to. Should call update() though.
